Buruh Minta UMP Naik 15%, Pengusaha: 8,51% Saja Sudah Berat
03 Nov 2019, 10:28 by Anisa Indraini


Foto: Agung Pambudhy

Jakarta - Gubernur sejumlah daerah telah mengumumkan kenaikan upah minimum provinsi (UMP) 2020 sebesar 8,51%. Meskipun begitu, kenaikan UMP ini masih menjadi perdebatan bagi para buruh. Ketua Umum DPD HIPPI DKI Jakarta Sarman Simanjorang meminta agar para buruh mengerti akan kondisi ekonomi saat ini. Sehingga buruh tidak lagi menuntut kenaikan UMP sebesar 15% yang dirasa berlebihan."Kami berharap serikat-serikat pekerja mengerti akan kondisi yang kita hadapi saat ini dan juga jangan menuntut berlebihan lah karena itu fakta-fakta yang ada di lapangan bagaimana kondisi ekonomi kita," tutur Sarman saat dihubungi detikcom, Minggu (3/11/2019).Dengan kondisi ekonomi sekarang ini, kata Sarman, kenaikan mencapai 8,51% sudah memberatkan bagi dunia usaha. Sehingga tidak mungkin jika kenaikan harus sampai 15%."Naik 8,51% saja sebenarnya sudah cukup berat bagi dunia usaha dengan kondisi sekarang ini. Apalagi kalo sampai naik 15%, saya rasa itu sesuatu yang tidak mungkin," katanya.Lebih lanjut, Sarman meminta untuk para buruh menghentikan polemik soal UMP. Ia mengajak untuk serikat pekerja, pemerintah, serta pengusaha untuk fokus pada pengembangan sumber daya manusia (SDM) di era industri 4.0."Ayolah kita bersama-sama membenahi SDM daripada tenaga kerja banyak minta," imbuhnya.Jika SDM memiliki daya saing serta kompetensi, Sarman memastikan mereka akan digaji di atas UMP yang ada."Kalo kualitas tenaga kerjanya bagus kita tidak perlu lagi bicara UMP, mereka sudah pasti mendapatkan gaji di atas UMP. Nggak usah bicara UMP kita akan naikkan," tegas Sarman.Simak Video "Asyik! UMP Tahun 2020 Naik 8,51%"[Gambas:Video 20detik](zlf/zlf)

Workers Ask UMP Up 15%, Employers: 8.51% Already Heavy
03 Nov 2019, 10:28 by Anisa Indraini


Photo: Agung Pambudhy

Jakarta - Governors in a number of regions have announced an increase in the provincial minimum wage (UMP) 2020 of 8.51%. Even so, the increase in the UMP is still a debate for the workers. DKI Jakarta DPD HIPPI Chairperson Sarman Simanjorang requested that workers understand the current economic conditions. So workers no longer demand an increase in the UMP of 15% which is considered excessive. "We hope that the unions understand the conditions we face today and also don't demand excessive demands because of the facts in the field how our economic conditions are," Sarman said when contacted by AFP on Sunday (3/11/2019). With the current economic conditions, Sarman said, the increase of 8.51% had become burdensome for the business world. So it's not possible if the increase should be up to 15%. "Just up 8.51% is actually already quite heavy for the business world with the current conditions. Moreover, if it goes up to 15%, I think it's something that is not possible," he said. Sarman asked the workers to stop the polemic about the UMP. He invited trade unions, governments, and employers to focus on developing human resources (HR) in the industrial era 4.0. "Come on, we will work together to improve HR rather than asking many workers," he added. If HR has competitiveness and competence, Sarman ensured they would be paid above the existing UMP. "If the quality of the workforce is good we don't need to talk about the UMP anymore, they certainly will get a salary above the UMP. No need to talk about the UMP we will raise it," Sarman said.
